spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_MDE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Quiet IRQ mode. Any device can initiate a SERIRQ transaction. 1: Continuous mode. Only the host initiates SERIRQ transactions (RESET VALUE). The IRQ_MDE value is decoded from the STOP length of each SERIRQ frame. The STOP length is 2 for Quiet mode, 3 for Continuous mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IRQ_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Disable SERIRQ port. 1: Enable SERIRQ port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: EINTR
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Disable interrupt, INTR. 1: Enable IBF as interrupt, INTR.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ELPC
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Disable LPC port. 1: Enable LPC port.

spirit:register.spirit:name: STS

spirit:field.spirit:name: S1
spirit:field.spirit:description: State bit 1. Bits 7 and 6 can be used to indicate the current state of the APB-side software driver. These bits are written by the driver. System software on the LPC-side could examine these bits to verify synchronization with the APB-side driver. See the description for bit 6.

spirit:field.spirit:name: S0
spirit:field.spirit:description: State bit 0. See bit 7 and the state table below. S1 S0 State 0 0 IDLE_STATE. Interface is idle. 0 1 READ_STATE. The APB-side driver is transferring a packet to LPC-side system software. LPC-idle system software should be in the "Read Message" state. 1 0 WRITE_STATE. The APB-side driver is receiving a packet from LPC-side system software. The LPC-side system software should be writing a command to CoreLPC. 1 1 ERROR_STATE. The APB-side driver has detected a protocol violation at the interface level, or the transfer has been aborted. LPC-side system software can either use the Get_Status control code to request the nature of the error, or retry the command.

spirit:field.spirit:name: OEM2
spirit:field.spirit:description: OEM2 read/write bit - reserved for CoreLPC implementer / system integrator definition.

spirit:field.spirit:name: OEM1
spirit:field.spirit:description: OEM1 read/write bit - reserved for CoreLPC implementer / system integrator definition.

spirit:field.spirit:name: C_DN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Specifies whether the last write was to the command cegister or the Data_In register (1 = command, 0 = data). The default base address of an I/O mapped KCS-SMS interface is 0xCA2. According to the IPMI specification for KCS, the command register is located at the base address + 1. As such, bit 0 of the incoming KCS I/O address is written into this bit, as it signifies a command write to the IBR. Otherwise it is a data write to the IBR.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SMS_ATN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 when the APB master has one or more messages in the receive message queue, or when a watchdog timer pre-timeout or event message buffer full condition exists. Refer to the IPMI specification for further information on the use and requirements for the SMS_ATN bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: KIBF
spirit:field.spirit:description: KCS input buffer register flag. Automatically set to 1 when either the associated command or Data_In byte has been written by the LPC-side system software to the IBR register. Cleared when the IBR has been read by the APB master.

spirit:field.spirit:name: KOBF
spirit:field.spirit:description: KCS output buffer register flag. Set to 1 when the associated Data_Out register (OBR) has been written by the APB master. Cleared when the OBR has been read by the LPC-side system software.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Status register. Bits 0-3 and 6-7 designed for KCS use, but can be used for any LPC-to-APB application.

spirit:register.spirit:name: KIRQ

spirit:field.spirit:name: KIRQ_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Disable parameter-configured KIRQ slot of SERIRQ port. 1: Enable parameter-configured KIRQ slot of SERIRQ port.

spirit:register.spirit:description: KCS IRQ configuration register. Used to configure the SERIRQ port for KCS use.

spirit:register.spirit:name: KIBR
spirit:register.spirit:description: KCS input buffer register; read only.

spirit:field.spirit:name: KADRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: KCS base address low register bits Contains the LSB of the 16-bit base address. For an I/O mapped KCS SMS interface base address of 0x0CA2, LADRL must be set to 0xA2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LADRH
spirit:field.spirit:description: KCS base address high register bits. Contains the MSB of the 16-bit base address. For an I/O mapped KCS SMS interface base address of 0x0CA2, LADRH must be set to 0x0C.

spirit:register.spirit:name: MIRQ

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_M_IRQ_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: APB master port interrupt number index to associate with its parameter configured SERIRQ slot enable, INT_M_IRQ_SEL_EN. 16 interrupts can be brought in from the APB master port if the KCS is not used; otherwise only 15 interrupts can be brought in from the APB master port , in addition to the one KCS interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_M_IRQ_SEL_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: Disable parameter-configured MIRQ slot of SERIRQ port. 1: Enable parameter-configured MIRQ slot of SERIRQ port.

spirit:register.spirit:description: APB master port IRQ configuration register. Used to enable the SERIRQ port for each interrupt coming from the APB master port.

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description: APB system clock; reference clock for all internal logic.
APB Active Low asynchronous reset.
APB address bus; address internal registers.
APB slave select; select signal for register reads or writes.
APB strobe. This signal indicates the second cycle of an APB transfer.
APB write/read. If High, a write occurs when an APB transfer takes place. If Low, a read takes place.
APB write data.
APB read data.
APB ready. Used to insert wait states. Not used in CoreLPC, but part of APB3 Interface. Tied High (always ready).
APB error. Not used in CoreLPC, but part of APB3 Interface. Tied Low.
Master I/F APB system clock; reference clock for all internal logic.
Master I/F APB Active Low asynchronous reset.
Master I/F APB address bus output.
Master I/F APB slave select output. Number of PSEL bits based on APB_MASTER_SLOT_NUM parameter. Maximum of 16 PSEL slots for 16 peripherals
Master I/F APB strobe output. This signal indicates the second cycle of an APB transfer.
Master I/F APB write/read output. If High, a write occurs when an APB transfer takes place. If Low, a read takes place.
Master I/F APB write data output.
Master I/F APB read data input.
Master I/F APB ready input.
Master I/F APB error input.
APB slave KCS interrupt output. This Active High output is the KCS Interface's interrupt output signal from CoreLPC.

APB master port's interrupt input array. These Active High inputs are the APB master port interrupts to CoreLPC. The array bits can be programmed to go into a SERIRQ slot, which are then forwarded to the LPC host device.
LPC address/data out: multiplexed command, address, and data input.
LPC address/data out: multiplexed command, address, and data output.
LPC frame: Indicates start of a new cycle, termination of broken cycle. Active Low.
Output enable signal used in push/pull LAD buffer configurations. Active Low.
LPC reset: Same as PCI reset on the host. Active Low.
LPC clock: Same 33 MHz clock as PCI clock on the LPC host. Same clock phase with typical PCI skew.
Serialized IRQ out.
Serialized IRQ in.
Output enable signal used in push/pull SERIRQ buffer configurations. Active Low.

spirit:hwParameter.spirit:prompt: LPC SYNC Value for Master Port transactions

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description: CoreLPC is a low pin count (LPC) peripheral APB component which accepts LPC host-side system interface commands to the APB-slave side keyboard control style (KCS) interface. Alternatively, LPC traffic can be sent directly to/from other APB peripherals via an APB Master Interface. Serial interrupt request (SERIRQ) logic may be utilized to aggregate interrupts onto a single line.
